channel.title: Writeln help
channel.description:
okay is it possible for
scar to check if a key is pressed then write the key in the debug box?
of do i have to do
if iskeydown('a') then writeln(a')

item.title: Writeln help
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

try this:

begin
if (iskeydown('a')) then
writeln('mujahed is leet')
end if
end

but in that script the script will only check once so do this:

begin
repeat
if (iskeydown('a')) then
writeln('mujahed is leet')
end if
until(false)
end

Ill post later to show you how to use procedures and variables in this specific script

EDIT*: i just tested it and it doesnt work. i really gtg now ill fix it for u later

Read full topic

item.title: Writeln help
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[code]
begin
iskeydown(‘a’);
then writeln(a’);
end.

[code/]

That is the only way I know of as well, You could do

begin
iskeydown(‘a’)
then writeln(‘a’)
iskeydown(‘a’)=false
then writeln(‘no a’)
end

Somthing similiar to that, Although thats a basic way to do it… Alot more advanced options[/code]

Read full topic
